description.narrative:
This investment responds to the ASEAN-Australia Strategic Partnership Plan of Action (PoA) and Australia’s Foreign Policy White Paper. It supports Disability Rights in ASEAN (DRiA) (AUD2.2m, 2017-2021), through the development and implementation of ASEAN’s Enabling Masterplan 2025: Mainstreaming the Rights of Persons with Disabilities. DRiA provides capacity building for ASEAN Disabled People’s Organisations (DPOs) and ASEAN bodies to effectively implement and monitor the Masterplan and enhances DPOs’ engagement in ASEAN processes. DRiA is implemented by the International Foundation for Electoral Systems (IFES) and General Election Network for Disability Access (AGENDA). The investment also supports the Australian Human Rights Commission (AHRC) for human rights dialogues and events in ASEAN (AUD480,000, 2019-2022) through its engagement with the ASEAN Intergovernmental Commission on Human Rights (AICHR).
Investment’s total value is AUD2.7m over 5 years, starting 1 May 2017.
